newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures end down but above lows.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures end down but above lows.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei futures ended weak on Wednesday amid poor sentiment on the underlying cash market where banking stocks were hit by bad debt concerns after last week's news of a construction firm's financial failure.
The lead Nikkei 225 September contract ended 190 points down at 19,695 after falling as low as 19,500.
"When it broke through 19,570, it went down to 19,500 fast and I thought it would test 19,200," a trader at a Japanese brokerage said.
"Most people were disappointed today because foreigners started with sell orders in the cash market despite the Dow finishing up yesterday," he added.
He said the market could rebound to 19,800-19,900 level on Thursday, which would provide a good opportunity to go short again.
"We're looking at weakness in the Nikkei. I don't see why we would go above the 20,000 level again soon," a dealer with a U.S. investment house said.
He said vague rumours about the failure of a regional Japanese bank and the dollar's weakness against the yen had contributed to the Nikkei's decline.
On Taiwan futures, the July contract ended 2.6 points higher at 398.1 on volume of 1,709 lots.
